chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant William T. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault) [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).
  • Intimidate Victim/Threaten Force, etc., a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders

supervisions.notes: Contacts with G.A., H.A., C.A., M.A., and A.P. will be screened from the Department of Corrections for appropriateness while he is incarcerated.

superMiscConds.notes:
plus 10% restitution surcharge.
Amount to be determined within 90 days.
25% of prison wages ordered to go toward restitution.

No possession or consumption of alcohol.
No entry into bars, taverns, or liquor stores.
Not to be in a vehicle transporting alcohol or have alcohol in his residence.
Must submit to a PBT if asked to do so by any law enforcement officer, and if alcohol is detected, must submit to a blood sample.
No contact with G.A., H.A., C.P., M.A., or A.P. unless in the event that any of them would request through his probation supervision to have contact with him.
DOC screening of communications while incarcerated to comply with no contact order.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old, other than incidental, but never unsupervised.

Undergo and comply with domestic violence assessment, if agent deems it appropriate, and follow-through with recommendations.
Participate in and complete Denier's Group per agent.
Participate in and complete Pre-Treatment Program and After Care Program if deemed necessary.
Must complete SO2 or SO4 program by the time probation term begins.
Comply with lifetime sex offender registry.
Comply with any other assessments, programming, treatment, or counseling per agent.
Undergo AODA and follow-through with recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
JOC corrected on 7/09/15 to more accurately reflect Judge's orders at sentencing hearing in regards to no contact conditions/orders.
Lifetime sex offender registration and compliance.
